page.title: Developer Tools
page.description: A section containing some useful tools to support development.

sectionRiskAnalysisExport.title: Risk Analysis Export
sectionRiskAnalysisExport.description: Export and import in formatted .json format the risk analysis you compile, ready to be used in purpose creation calls in machine-to-machine flows.

sectionDebugClientAssertion.title: Debug Client Assertion
sectionDebugClientAssertion.description: Tool to generate, view, and validate client assertion JWT, useful for debugging and integration with OAuth 2.0 flows.

sectionVoucherSimulation.title: Simulate getting a voucher
sectionVoucherSimulation.description: Through this feature you can simulate obtaining a voucher. Once you have selected the parameters, you can perform a client assertion, request a voucher and verify that it is compatible.

page.title: Risk Analysis Export
page.description: The export tool allows you to export in formatted .json format the risk analysis you compile, ready to be used in purpose creation calls in machine-to-machine flows.
page.alertInfo: The risk analysis import feature will be available soon.

jsonExportStep.title: Your JSON export
jsonExportStep.successAlert: The risk analysis has been fully completed and has generated a correctly formatted output.
jsonExportStep.warningAlertTitle: The risk analysis has been partially completed.

riskAnalysisSection.title: Risk analysis
riskAnalysisSection.description: Indicate for whom you are compiling this risk analysis.
riskAnalysisSection.privateOption: Public service managers, publicly controlled companies, or private entities
riskAnalysisSection.warningAlert: You have chosen to compile a risk analysis for a party type different from yours. Remember that risk analyses vary based on the party type, therefore the one you are compiling may not work for you.
